definition: to utter a word/to make a sound/to cheep/to squeak/also pr. [zi1 sheng1]
(onom.) to squeak (of mice)/to chirp or peep (of small birds)

sentences.english: But none of us asked any questions.
sentences.chinese: 但是我們誰也沒有吱聲。

sentences.english: The mouse squeaked in the corner.
sentences.chinese: 牆角處有老鼠的吱吱聲。

sentences.english: My feet took turns kicking at the thick snow, making a dull squeaking sound.
sentences.chinese: 我的腳輪流踩在厚厚的雪地上，發出單調的吱吱聲。

sentences.english: The children don't dare(to)make a sound while their parents are sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 父母親睡覺的時候，孩子們都不敢吱聲。

sentences.english: With a continuous supply of bubbles, you might get tired of all that popping.
sentences.chinese: 因爲氣泡源源不絕，你可能還會聽噗吱聲聽到煩呢。

sentences.english: The man said nothing, only bow to wipe his cup.
sentences.chinese: 那個小文沒吱聲，只是低頭擦拭着手裏的杯子。

sentences.english: Picard saw her he made a sign of silence.
sentences.chinese: 皮卡德一看到她馬上示意她別吱聲。

sentences.english: Every time they hear a few Russian felt boots swishing in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 他們不過聽到幾個俄國人靴子在雪地上的吱吱聲。

sentences.english: With a rusty squeak, a pair of steel doors slid open.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨這因生鏽而發出的吱吱聲，兩扇鋼門打開了。

sentences.english: He went on looking at the sea in silence. My wrinkles deepened.
sentences.chinese: 他看着大海沒吱聲，我的皺紋可加深了。

sentences.english: Everyone fall silent when the teacher come.
sentences.chinese: 教師進來時人人都不吱聲了。

sentences.english: When questioned, he invariably dummy up.
sentences.chinese: 一問到他，他總是不吱聲。

sentences.english: Wang Lung continued to dip the water to the last drop. He did no answer.
sentences.chinese: 王龍沒吱聲，繼續把水都倒光。

sentences.english: The brakes of the car squealed.
I finally managed to cure the rattling noise in my car.
sentences.chinese: 我最終設法解決了汽車發出的吱吱聲。

sentences.english: Squeak coming from wood beams becomes semitone of well water.
sentences.chinese: 木樑的吱吱聲成了井水的伴音。
